body.p: To enable audit logging you must edit your cloud configuration settings, save your changes and re-run the configuration processor. Then you can run the playbooks to create the volume groups and configure them.
In the CloudConfig file, service names defined under enabled-services or disabled-services override the default setting.
The following is an example of your audit-settings section:
body.codeblock: audit-settings: audit-dir: /var/audit default: disabled enabled-services: - keystone - barbican disabled-services: - nova # - barbican # - keystone - cinder - ceilometer
body.p: In this example, although the default setting for all services is set to disabled, keystone and barbicon have been explicitly set as enabled and this setting overrides the default.
